reviews.sentence: Exactly what you had expect. We stayed here while attending an event at UMD and I would say the hotel met our expectations. The rooms were comfortable enough and the service was friendly. Wifi in the hotel was pretty quick. One thing to note though is that if you do not have a car with you you are pretty much limited to TGIFridays in terms of walking distance businesses and that is definitely less than ideal. There were a few little things that could have been improved we had a room with a fold out couch and while there was room to unfold it there was a bulky table in the way that we had to awkwardly stow and block the hallway area with. Additionally the pull out bed was incredibly uncomfortable so if you are looking to use one I might suggest a different hotel. Overall though I do not imagine you are going to do much better in Greenbelt and for the price it is not bad at all.

Nothing special. I wish the rest of the hotel was as updated at the lobby. Locality to the University highway. The pool was gross and the hot tub was full of numerous children that I am pretty sure are not supposed to be in there. The room was tight and most of the furniture seemed old. There was some mold in the bathroom.
very nice and friendly staff. clean hotelI had to be moved to 3 rooms. the first two rooms had an bad mildew odor.

Comfortable beds free parking. This was hotel five in as many days. At this point our essentials were a comfortable bed no funky smell in the room and access to ice. This hotel met all those requirements. I tried to find hotels w free breakfast but alas this one had breakfast just not free. So we had McDs instead. It was in a central location and we had no trouble finding it. As we arrived late we did not get to the pool or enjoy the flat screen tv. but we did hop on the free wifi. No issues. I recommend. Comfortable bed University of Maryland.

Excellent staff and nice rooms. I stayed in this Courtyard for work and was there a total of 4 nights. I have stayed in many hotels and the staff at this one was top notch. Now mind you I prefer my staff friendly sociable and low key. Each morning they were extremely pleasant when I got breakfast even though they were extremely busy and very attentive to my needs. The hotel itself is very nice. Everything was extremely clean which is the first thing I look for. In addition everything smelled wonderful with a faint flowery odor that reminds me of vacation. The beds were very comfortable the pillows a perfect medium softness. They change your towels out daily though you can make it so they do not simply by hanging your towels up and they come in and empty the trash and reset the sheets every day. This makes each night feel like a fresh night. As a note I brought my own pillow and blanket and they set up my pillow with the rest on the bed and folded my blanket for me as well. Little touches go a long way. There is a board in the main lobby that will display all sorts of information regarding the area you are in. I got some recommendations for local food from this board. As well there is a state park across the street. A small note there is a print center in the lobby that is EXTREMELY useful and free. should you need to print tickets directions business documents. Why four stars. The two pain points are the rather small and cramped fitness center two treadmills an elliptical and a bench with free weights and the pool. The fitness center was serviceable do not get me wrong and everything worked. However four people in there at once got very very crowded. The pool was an annoyance as well. it does not open till 170 Monday through Friday which is a poor choice in my opinion. Some background I was there with a work group so our dinners were ready between 170 and 180. The difficulty here is choosing whether to have a cold dinner because I decided to go swimming or having a full stomach when I try to go swimming. Secondly the guy who opened and cleaned the pool did not get there until 170 which means the pool did not really open until 1730. I never did get to go swimming so I can not particularly give a review of the pool itself. One last thing the coin operated laundry was VERY VERY expensive. 250 each for the washer and dryer is too much in my opinion considering the small size of the washer and dryerHowever this inconvenienced me I still enjoyed the hotel and my stay. The food was also very good if a bit on the pricey side normal prices for a hotel though. Overall I would consider vacationing here.

Exceptional. Staff was very professional and friendly. They took the time to check with us to making sure we were comfortable. They made us feel like very special guestscanot think of anything we did not like. We were very pleased with our recent stay as well as our past stays.

Disgusting Treatmeant by Employee Vanessa. On Saturday November 18 2016 I was treated in the most digesting and dehumanizing manner by Vanessa front desk agent. I arrived shortly after 1030pm to check in for one night. My grandmother died and I had to make an emergency trip from Atlanta to DC. In my haste I left my wallet in my car at the airport but prepaid for my room online. When I arrived I was greeted by Akon who was lovely by the way. I explained my situation to her that I had left my wallet and that I would be going to SunTrust in the morning to get cash for the rest of my trip. She told me she needed funds for incidentals and I informed her that I did not have any funds on me outside of my ability to use my credit card via Apple Pay. She went to speak to the supervisor who was Vanessa who came out to talk to me in a nasty disgusting manner as if I was scum of the bottom of her shoe. I tried to explain my situation to her but she rolled her eyes and neck and started waving her hands at me. She would not let me talk and kept saying you are not listening to ME as if I was some child she was scolding. She then said I am DONE talking to you until you want to listen. At this point I was pretty upset and needed to walk away. I have NEVER encountered that Tempe of behavior some someone who was supposed to be a reflection of the management. She kept calling me rude but would not let me get a word in edgewise wise. I felt like I was in the middle of some reality show where the women talk like trash to each other and yell to get their point across. Her behavior especially as a leader was 100 unacceptable. I am in town for 24hours to mourn the death of my loved one not to be treated like someone trying to steal a room for the night. I am asking for the strictest corrective action to be taken. Please have the general manager and owner of the hotel contact me directly as soon as possible. With much sorrow Disappointed Guest.

Reasonably priced in an expensive area. Went to the DC area to visit my daughter. I found this hotel to be reasonably priced for the area however the restaurant snack bar was always closed except for a small amount of time that coincided with meal times. Not very convenient.
Okay. The pen marks on the walls and bathroom door. The assistant manager never called me back the pool area hard to find one step above of a motel.

About what one would expect at a Courtyard Hotel. The room was fine and in general quite comfortable. My only complaint would be that it took a couple days for things to be replenished kleenex makeup remover.

OTRT II Concert Visit. Greetings. I statyed at the courtyard to attend a concert. I called the hotel prior to arrival and spoke wt Cheryl to gain an understanding of the metro vs uber. Cheryl was phenomenal. Upon my arrival we had issues with the room Charnita immediately expressed her concern proceeded to rectify the situation. Due to no fault of her own the situation could n’t be handled that night so she made sure she thoroughly documented the experience for the manager. The following morning Cheryl took excellent care of us. These women ROCK. They do the Mariot brand justice. They were chipper they call you by name personable. and they went above beyond to assist every guest. The Courtyard needs to upgrade their facility mildew ants. The facility needs to match the staff.

extended stay at Greenbelt Courtyard by Mariot July 2018. had a great experience. Staff was excellent. Facilities manager was responsive to our requests for meeting rooms. Front desk staff were helpful and responsive as were the cafe employees both morning and evening.

Great lobby. Evenbeter hotel staff. I have been to this location several times and usually get Jesica up front who really takes care of her guest. A very bubbly and very helpful person. The rest of the staff is super attentive too. stayed at other courtyards around maryland this is one of the better ones.
Hotel was clean andcomfortable. Staff was very welcoming. Would definitely stay again.
Traveled for business. Love the amenities and food in the hotel itself.

Amazing Stay. Lovely Staff. Hello My name is Britney Baker and I had the pleasure of staying at this property. Not only was the property cozy and close to the Venue I traveled in for but the staff were so kind and helpful. In particular Charnita Atchison was a great help and and amazing resource during my stay. I will surely be back.
Nice place to stay. it is near by university of Maryland university College. it is really cool place. it is beside the road and have good parking space.
Fantastic Hotel with friendly staff amazing breakfast and truly comfy rooms.

Great Customer Service. I had an issue with the room we were in on our first night noisy neighbors and Cheryl at the front desk did a great job making the rest of our stay positive. The hotel is a great location for visiting UMD. We are staying here again 2 weeks later and Cheryl greeted me and checked me in with a smile and it was quick and easy.

Great Customer Service and Staff so friendly and so welcoming. First of all when we arrived at the hotel for our weekend stay the staff was so accommodating at check in and very open to all questions needs and wants. Waking up this morning going down to the front desk needing some assistance in checking in a second room that I need for family coming in out of town Mrs Cheryl was so helpful in assisting me but not only that made me feel right at home. Sticking around the front desk in waiting for some people to come down so that we could go to breakfast I was able to watch Mrs Cheryl work with other guest at that the hotel and she was superb and help each guest and was going beyond the call of customer service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Great service and great staff.
